result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lance Montrell Porter

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Lance Montrell Porter appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke appeared by video for Lance Montrell Porter.  Attorney Joshua Miles Mathy appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Final PreTrial with Defendant's other Case, 22CF1277. Discussion placed on the record. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. State complied with Victim Notification. Plea hearing proceeded. Negotiations placed on the record, and confirmed by Defense and Defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1 AND COUNT 2: 
Defendant changed his plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to the plea, and advised of Constitutional Rights and maximum penalties. Defendant advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found Defendant knowingly, voluntarily, and intelligently waived all his rights. Parties stipulated to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis for the plea. Court found Defendant GUILTY as charged in the Information, and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction. 

AS TO COUNT 3: 
Pursuant to negotiations and on Motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT 3 DISMISSED BUT READ-IN for the purpose of Sentencing. 

Court advised Defendant that he is prohibited from firearm possession, ammunition, or body armor. 
Court advised Defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and he may not vote until his civil rights are restored. 

Court VACATED SPEEDY Jury Trial date. 
Court ordered case adjourned for Sentencing hearing, Branch 46. Hearing will be held in Room 113 of the Safety Building. 
Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 11:00 am.

FILED: Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum, and Elements of the Offense/Jury Instructions.
-received and filed.
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement; received and filed.
Addendum to Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights; received and filed.
-Possession of a Firearm; received and filed.
State's Motion for Consolidation and Joinder; received, filed, and forwarded to the Judge for review.
State's Witness List; received and filed.
State's Motion in Limine; received and filed.
State's Proposed Jury Instructions; received and filed.
Defense Witness List; received and filed.
STIPULATION REGARDING USE OF VIDEOTAPED STATEMENTS; received, filed, and forwarded to the Judge for review.

Defendant Lance Montrell Porter not in court, in custody.  Attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke appeared by video for Lance Montrell Porter.  Attorney Joshua Miles Mathy appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Scheduling Conference with Defendant's other case 22CF1277. Discussion placed on the record. Defense received discovery material and an offer from the State. Defense advised the Court of issue with Discovery. State confirmed. Defense requested Final PreTrial and Jury Trial dates. Court ordered parties to submit their Motions in Limine, Jury Instructions, and Witness Lists by the Final PreTrial date. Any Motions are due by the Final PreTrial date. If the parties believe a necessary witness for the State or Defense requires independent representation, they are to make arrangements for that representation through the Public Defender's Office two (2) weeks in advance of the Final PreTrial. Court ordered case adjourned for Final PreTrial and SPEEDY Jury Trial. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. 

Final PreTrial scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 10:30. Hearing will be held via Zoom Video Conference. 
SPEEDY Jury Trial scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 09:00 am. Trial will be held in Room 113 of the Safety Building.
Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion to Suppress Evidence Obtained from Search.  (Lance Montrell Porter - #2022007022, House of Correction, 8885 S 68th St, Franklin WI 53132).

Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion for Speedy Trial.  (Lance Montrell Porter - #2022007022, House of Correction, 8885 S 68th St, Franklin WI 53132).

EXPIRES NOVEMBER 22, 2022.

Defendant Lance Montrell Porter in court with attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke.  Defendant Lance Montrell Porter in custody at HOC.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  Lance Montrell Porter appeared by video means with Attorney.  Preliminary hearing proceeded. Court took judicial notice of case #06CF4964 and case #22CF1277. Sworn for the State: MPD Officer E. Maldonado. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 46.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke in Court, Defendant Lance Montrell Porter not in Court, in custody.  Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in Court for Order to Show Cause hearing with Defendant's other Case, 22CF1277. Due to COVID-19 protocol, Defendant was not able to appear for today's hearing. Discussion placed on the record. Attorney Wineke was recently appointed by the Public Defender's Office. Court ordered case adjourned for Preliminary hearing, Branch PE. Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court adjourns case for an attorney to be appointed. Court finds good CAUSE to adjourn preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Case in Court for Bail/Bond hearing. Defendant has NEW CASE, 22CF1277. Public Defender's Office has NOT appointed counsel for Defendant. Court is not able to conduct bail hearing. Case adjourned for Preliminary herding, Branch PE. Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 08:30 am. 

Defendant needs counsel appointed. Clerk provided information to the Public Defender's Office.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Lance Montrell Porter in court with attorney Angel L Johnson.  Defendant Lance Montrell Porter in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Lance Montrell Porter appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant has lower number case(s) 22CF1277 pending.  Defendant is advised this case is reassigned to Judge Feiss, Branch 46. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defense request to be heard on bail.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 10:45 am.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
